That is, premeasure, chop,

Then Sarah Jessica Parker's

That is, painstakingly and

You know, the unnecessarily fussy way.

So once we've painstakingly

It's important to slice thinly

we're ready to continue

before thinly slicing, five eggs,

three cups of whole milk,
one teaspoon kosher salt,

one teaspoon oregano, quarter
teaspoon of garlic powder,

and a dozen black olives thinly sliced.

So, thanks Kendall.

Then we're laying down

lightly pressing them down

torn into little pieces,
half of our thin tomato slices,

all of our onions, our

the rest of the mozzarella slices.

And then we're topping that

Then each star gets its own tomato slice,
or, you know, close enough.
Next up we need to build the custard

Combining the three cups of
whole milk, five large eggs,
a pinch of salt, and a few twists

which is why they're not mised.

But then we're adding
our teaspoon of oregano
and quarter teaspoon of garlic powder.
Whisking until homogenous,
just as fast as your wrist will allow.

And carefully pouring over

making sure to saturate
all the bread on top.

Only two steps left to go.

That's our two ounces of
finely grated Parmesan cheese

is he gonna spill it for comic effect?
And the answer is no.
Jess loves this movie
and she wants to try the real thing.
So the next morning, we're very carefully
transporting the strata from the fridge,
removing the plastic wrap,
and baking for one to one and a half hours

in the preheated 325
degree Fahrenheit oven.
Until it's quite possibly

the most beautiful
strata you've ever seen.
